metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9839 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In MapServer before 7.0.3, OGR driver error messages are too verbose and may leak sensitive information if data connection fails.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9839` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cgi-mapserver - 7.0.3-1
libmapscript-java - 7.0.3-1
libmapscript-perl - 7.0.3-1
libmapserver2 - 7.0.3-1
mapserver-bin - 7.0.3-1
python-mapscript - 7.0.3-1
ruby-mapscript - 7.0.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mapserver package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.0.3-1').
